page.title: 01Willesborough
page.content: Willesborough is east of Ashford. The area around the junior school is mostly used for housing and shops. New brick built houses have appeared on old farming land. Factories and the motorway have recently been built and they cover a large area. The children think the motorway is ugly, dangerous, noisy but fresh and clean nearby. Houses,factories, churches and many fields lie near the road. There was an old workhouse, used later as a hospital and now as flats and a nursery. The new William Harvey Hospital replaced the old hospital. Some old, dark cottages have Kent peg tiles and sashed windows. The new bungalows have tiled roofs,new windows and tidy, neat gardens. Three hundred more houses are being built at present on the eastern edge.
